articles.title: Introducing Share Consumer Support (Kafka Queues) in Spring for Apache Kafka
articles.description: Continuing our Road to GA series, this week we're exploring Share Groups in Apache Kafka 4.0.0 and their integration in Spring for Apache Kafka 4.0.0 - a feature that fundamentally expands how we can consume messages from Kafka topics. When we first start working with Kafka, the mental model is straightforward: topics hold messages, consumers read them, and processing happens in order within partitions. This partition-based model has served countless applications well, providing ordered processi

articles.description: "As developers, we need precision. This guide details the exact 11-step lifecycle sequence of an Angular component, straight from the official docs. Ignoring the proper order leads to runtime errors and performance issues. Let's look at the complete chain, focusing on the most critical distinctions.

articles.title: Master RxJS Error Handling Once and for All ‚Äî 3 Core Strategies You Should Know
articles.description: As developers, we often focus too much on the happy path ‚Äî the perfect scenario where everything works smoothly and no API ever fails. But in the real world, one tiny error can derail your entire app from its destination. Error handling in RxJS is one of those underrated concepts that even experienced Angular devs struggle with. In this post (and the video linked below), I‚Äôll break down 3 core strategies that can help you design a clean, scalable, and resilient RxJS Error Handling Architecture.

articles.title: Testing gRPC Services in Java
articles.description: gRPC is a high-performance RPC framework that uses protocol buffers for defining services and messages. For reliable systems, you should unit test your service logic. For gRPC services, it is common to test the service implementation with an InProcessServer (no network) and an InProcessChannel client. That lets you verify behavior end-to-end while keeping tests fast …

articles.title: Micro Frontends with Angular and Native Federation
articles.description: Enterprise-scale software systems are often implemented by several cross-functional teams. To enable such teams to provide new features efficiently, it is desirable to minimize the need for coordination between them. This calls for a modularization that verticalizes the system into low-coupled areas individual teams can take care of.There are several possibilities for implementing such high-level modules (also called verticals). articles.title: Image Manipulation in Laravel With Glide
articles.description: Glide for Laravel is a package that provides on-the-fly image manipulation using League/Glide. It offers Blade components for generating responsive images, URL signing for security, and seamless integration with Laravel's filesystem and caching layers.
